intro: Gonocarpus depressus, commonly known as the swamp bladderwort, is a unique aquatic plant found in wetland environments. It is characterized by its small, bladder-like structures that trap tiny organisms, aiding in its nutrient acquisition. The plant has a submerged, branching stem with whorled leaves that are often reduced to scales. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae, which includes carnivorous plants. Gonocarpus depressus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to nutrient cycling and providing habitat for microorganisms.
